[{"id":"dev-17211","entityId":"86-22704","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Alter booking] Add store switcher to the list of proposed products"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"created","value":"1580301991041"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17211"},{"name":"description","value":"

The list of proposed products in the "Alter Booking" section should be grouped by the store the same way as it is done on booking creation in POS.

Acceptance criteria:

  • The flag indicating the current booking store is shown above the product title on the "Old" side.
  • The store switcher is shown above the product title on the "New" side.
  • The same store as the current booking is pre-selected in the store switcher.
  • Only the products that are available in a selected store are displayed in the list of proposed offers.
  • The product, variation and option titles are displayed in the language of selected store.
  • When a store is changed the same product should remain selected with all options and qtys untouched but translated to a new language.
  • If the previously selected product is not available in a newly selected store, than either the original product should be chosen or the first available product (depending on the availability)

@Sergey Dorogavcev
Fixed issue, when there are no products available in selected locale.

Please check logic when you return available products for selected locale, it should be the same as in POS page.
For example, demo account has 1 product in Turkish locale, and it is hidden in POS but shown in alter booking tab.

@Yana Pysotska @Naomi
In this ticket I also fixed issues with custom select+autocomplete. When you select locale or category and there are no any products, it shows as currently selected product the one which was previously selected.

Please check all the places where we have custom select dropdowns with autocomplete.

Also test please custom select in POS page on live, to confirm this issue.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1585040804952,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-66829","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17211","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The language (store) of the original booking is taken from the order. And it is never changed in the order even when the booking is altered (which is correct behavior, it should not be changed). As for now we don't store any information on the booking level about the store of the product. In order to fix the mentioned problem we need to fix the bigger issue and store the store ID on the booking level. If needed we can create a separate ticket for that.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1585043566536,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"dev-17819","entityId":"86-23078","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Import Bookings] User Story #2: Place bookings from File template"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Alexander Bechte"},{"name":"created","value":"1583224820984"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17819"},{"name":"description","value":"

As a user I want to upload a sheet with my booking data to place bookings in Regiondo.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • The optional values do not have to be filled to import bookings
  • The ‘not optional’/ Required values needs to be filled to place bookings
  • The offers already needs to be created to import bookings since the option ID is required to import bookings
  • Show the customer that the offers already have to be created to import bookings
  • Bookings from the past can be pasted
  • The bookings and also the tickets will be generated
  • No emails will be send out to the customers
  • Overbookings are allowed
  • Create new availabilities for bookings which are placed at a time which hasn't got predefined timeslots.
  • The booking date will be the date of migration
  • No order options will be imported

@Alexander Bechte
Questions:

  • No order options will be imported - order options - what is it? Custom fields?
  • Show the customer that the offers already have to be created to import bookings - how?
  • Can tickets be generated asynchronously later after bookings?
  • should there be any limitations for the imported bookings? (i.e. can they be cancelled or altered?)
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1583491681894,"updated":1583502331175,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-66522","author":"alexander.bechte","authorFullName":"Alexander Bechte","issueId":"dev-17819","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

  1. Order options: https://www.regiondo.com/resellers/account/orderoptions
    I just use the wording from the dashboard :)

  2. It can be a notification in the dashboard or notification in the sheet. You can decide about the best way - for me it is important that we will show it at all.

  3. Can you further explain me? But yes as I understand you it won't be an issue when the tickets are not created immediately.

  4. No limitations planned but if you have any concerns please tell.

@Maksym Hopei

Bugaichuk","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Yann Maurer

  1. For me text "Sorry, there is no online availability for June 2023." does not correspond to the requirement "there are no more appointments bookable online". The word "for" in the message means exactely the same that empty calendar for the current month and gives no additional information about the future availability. Probably we should use something like "Sorry, there is no online availability starting from June 2023."
  2. Should we fix the behavior when "Time" line and quantity selector remain when customer switches to month without any appointment?
  3. How to open 16123 [Booking widget] No upcoming date available (1).sketch attachment?

P.S. For such cases we should suggest to client to not use calendar representation but drop-down or disable possibility to select it on preview phase with some explanation.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1563353290218,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-60009","author":"g.horvath","authorFullName":"György Horváth","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Andrii Bugaichuk
1.) Agree, if we don't have any appointment later.
2.) I would agree, it would look better, but I think it's unnecessary dev cost. Our users probably won't get to see it. As they would stop reading/looking at the phone number.
3.) Open the png file or download the app here: https://www.sketch.com/. Or please use the following. Text= Roboto, 19, Bold. Border size = size of the calendar. Border color: color of past days.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1563355697224,"updated":1563355936904,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-60059","author":"y.maurer","authorFullName":"Yann Maurer","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The reality is that often supplier pre-fill appointments for a longer period of time (eventually 12 months) but forget to populate new availbilites when the end of the season approaches, so suggesting a drop-down would not help

Logic is:
When you click prev month on calendar - you can't switch to the month earlier than first available date.
When you click next month on calendar - if you switch to month later than last available date, and this month has no dates, the "sorry" text should appear.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1540979732575,"updated":1542818087775,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-54571","author":"sergey.chorny","authorFullName":"Sergey Chorny","issueId":"dev-14645","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Yann Maurer

Booking Widget Relaunch - Step by Step

Actual result:

Within current booking widget we use iframe to isolate its CSS rules and global JS variables from parent page. Also it is required to handle payments with credit cards on our side. Such payment methods as PayPal and Sofort are not working correctly in iframe and needs to be redirect to payments gateway page.
Because of iframe limitations we have to use cross-domain messaging technique for iframe auto resizing, and for transferring google analytics client id and events.
Current design is outdated, old jQuery UI accordion and datepicker are used.

Expected result:

  1. Avoid using iframe within booking widget, render html/css on-the-fly directly on the page with js.
    For each payment method we can use separate window or redirection to a payment gateway page.
  2. Avoid using JS frameworks or libraries, as it can break parent's page functionality.
  3. Use React.
  4. Use minimal third-party scripts.
  5. Redo html/css markup based on new design, keeping in mind that html tags can inherit parent page css rules.
  6. Retain availability colors functionality.
  7. Create option to show 1, 2, or 3 months initially.

Things to consider:

  1. First of all it needs to decide what to do - renew our current booking widget, or create new "react" version of it, without backward compatibility.
  • If we decide to renew what we have right now, it will be difficult to release our changes even by small chunks, as css will be inherited from parent page. And if we try to use !important, it will break "Custom CSS" functionality. Most of js will be deprecated because it is done for iframe version, and it will be difficult to maintain both of them within one booking widget snippet.
  • It could be good to have an additional version of booking widget page, or at least have with radio options, for example: "lightframe (new)" or "iframe (deprecated)". This way suppliers can do easier transition to new version of optimized widget, or have an option to stay with stable old iframe.

  1. Currently our widget contains two parts - first is client js part, second part is what we load inside iframe. Because of inside iframe, we can use any framework/library we need, while client's part is written with "vanilla" js using anonymous functions for code isolation. It means that if we want to use react on parent's page, we need to check if it is already added, then we probably can use it. If parent page has no react scripts - it could be risky to add it on-the-fly.

  2. For payment options we have to use redirect to payment gateway pages, or proceed to open separate new window. New window should be opened immediately (max 1 second delay), otherwise it will be blocked by browser. As a workaround we have to open new window right after user clicks "Place Order", show loading indicator, and load responses into that window after back-end prepare all the data.

  3. Deep-link functionality will be deprecated, and needs to be reviewed if we have to retain it.

  4. Existing "Custom CSS" functionality can be broken for renewed widget, and possibly can be applied for checkout pages, eg. stripe credit card form.

  5. Google Analytics and Tag manager should be reconsidered, as if we load our GTM container on a page it can interfere with existing GTM containers.

  6. Minimized (packed) JS files on supplier's side can add difficulties for debugging possible issues, compilers and packers should be used carefully.

  7. In case of some unexpected JS errors on supplier's website our widget will fail to load.

Pre-phase:

Gather requirements, create few "real-world" test examples, make decisions about how to renew or create new version.
Discuss possible bottlenecks and limitations, find optimal solution to refactor current functionality (without losing mind completely).

Phase 1:

It needs to get rid of iframe on 1st step of booking widget - date/option/variation selection steps.

1.1 Rewrite selection steps to build markup on-the-fly (vanilla js or react).
1.2 Optimize requests to server, and retrieve minimal information based on product type and preselected data.
1.3 Remove UI accordion and use simple fold/unfold css animation instead.
1.4 Choose suitable third-party tiny calendar script, or decide to stay with jQuery datepicker, or create custom calendar class with only things we use. Or - http://react-day-picker.js.org/
1.5 Apply CSS rules based on new design examples, considering that suppliers should have possibility to rewrite CSS.
1.6 Create new "regiondo-booking.js" without old js code, used for iframe.
1.7 Continue with "Buy as a Gift" product type.
1.8 Continue with "Voucher" product type.
1.9 Continue with "Bundle" product type.

Shopping cart and checkout pages should work as it is, same for shopping cart and checkout in lightboxes.

Phase 2:

It needs to remove iframe on Shopping Cart step.

2.1 Remove all the magento related css/js.
2.2 Rewrite shopping cart page to build markup on-the-fly.
2.3 Create a possibility to proceed directly to cart after adding product, or stay on same step. Retain option to open shopping cart in lightbox. Could be good to have an option to skip Shopping cart page and proceed directly to checkout pages (dev-13729).
2.4 Use "Coupon Code" as a separate block, as it can be shown on cart page and on checkout pages as well.
2.5 Use "Totals" as a separate block, as it can be shown on cart page and on checkout pages as well.

Checkout pages stays the same.

Phase 3:

It needs to remove iframe on Checkout steps.

Do we have possibility to allow resellers to collect customers information on their own page ? What if they have no https? GDPR?
Do we have possibility to customize any payment gateway pages we use? Do we need to create separate page for stripe's credit card form? Or do they also have separate gateway page which has better PCI Compliance than we do?
https://support.stripe.com/questions/can-my-customers-go-to-stripe-com-to-make-a-payment
https://stripe.com/docs/recipes/elements-react

3.1 Remove all the magento related css/js.
3.2 Rewrite checkout steps to build markup on-the-fly.
3.3 Review and correct all the form fields validation and filtering.
3.4 Rewrite "Contact" page.
3.5 Rewrite "Shipping" page.
3.6 Rewrite "Billing" page.
3.7 Rewrite "Success" page.
3.8 Improve Success page loading, add tickets "preview" blocks to make them available immediately after purchase.
3.9 Create better payment/order failure page.

György Horváth Yann Maurer

Summary of what we discussed:

1. Calendar coloring - without trafic lights - bold grey days & grey selection circle
2. Calendar coloring - with trafic lights - colored days & colored selection circle
3. Time slots are separated, multiple rows, also example with colored slots when trafic lights is used
4. Option line - with old price, sale price, final price after discoount - question mark icon with slide out text box - edit icon - option title example when it goes on top of quantity and price items - disabled -/+, and hilighted only on click -
5. Total price line - * tax is included, and "2 items in cart" line - show discount amount, price per each options coupon code, etc
6. Login form, reset password form, if not registered - do we need to have option to create new account with us, so we need to provide "create bew account" option field with "choose password" fields?
7. Payment methods step - we need to have option boxes, subscribe to newsletters line, textarea with a lot of lines with scrollbar.
8. Notification boxes - errors when we didn't select something, success text when product is added to cart, or warning when selected qty is not already available.
9. Buy as a gift - radio buttons to select if you buy 1 single or multi gift certificates.
10. Addon page with 3-4 rows of additional products with smaller images.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1553164208885,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-57296","author":"sergey.chorny","authorFullName":"Sergey Chorny","issueId":"dev-14645","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
György Horváth Yann Maurer

And also old requests to keep it here:

Additionally we need to have design example of these booking widget parts (see attached images):

1. Messages:
a) Success - "Item has been added to cart."
b) Error - "Product can't be added to cart. Please specify the product option(s) first."
c) Notification - "We are sorry but there are no products available for this date."

2. Tooltip for "?" icon on the options row.

3. Radio selector to choose single or multiple certificate within Gift tab.

4. Sold out products.

5. "Edit" icon - as we can't have just word edit, because of multiple languages (keep in mind that selected option name can be really long text string).

6. Left & Right arrow icons for calendar to switch months. Also could be good to have an example of some loading animation when switching months.

@Denys Bulakh

I need help from back-end developer, here is the list:

  1. Fix new Bookingwidget module (app/code/local/Regiondo/Bookingwidget), so that dashboard menu item, IndexController, helpers, and dashboard page template works as expected (app/design/frontend/regiondo/default/template/resellers/account/partner/account/websiteintegration/bookingwidget-params.phtml)
  2. It needs to create /bookingwidget/ action to accept parameters (similar to calendar widget, ex. const REQUEST_PARAM_NAME_STORE = 's') which will be used later to set preselected date, or time, or discount coupon etc.
  3. It needs to create /bookingwidget/params actions to store variables from dashboard page based on selected settings for widget from reseller.
  4. Create helper "getTranslations($locale)" (/app/code/local/Regiondo/Bookingwidget/Helper/Widget.php) which will return array of translated strings based on requested locale code, example: getTranslations('en_US'), getTranslations('de_DE')
  5. Create helper getColors() which will return all the color settings of the reseler for requested WL store.
  6. Create actions in bookingwidget controller which will returns JSON data:
    A) /bookingwidget/data/widget - json with reseller's shop related settings, list of available locales, list of available currencies, list of date formats, all the settings which are not product bases, and not changed often (ex. react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataDates.js)
    B) /bookingwidget/data/product - json with all the product based settings and data: id, name, type, product settings (react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataProduct.js)
    C) /bookingwidget/data/translations - json with translated strings array for selected locale (react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataTranslations.js)
    D) /bookingwidget/data/variations - json with list of available variations (react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataVariations.js)
    E) /bookingwidget/data/options - json with list of available options of selected variation (react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataOptions.js)
    F) /bookingwidget/data/dates - json with list of available dates with times, and all the related data, structure is similar to what we have currently on live (react/bookingwidget/public/json/dataDates.js)
  7. Create "addToCart" helper which will add product to cart based on customer selections and returns all the products added to cart.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1573725419399,"updated":1573727597443,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64122","author":"sergey.chorny","authorFullName":"Sergey Chorny","issueId":"dev-14645","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Alexander Bechte Walid Dechri

Color Settings:


As I mentioned before, current list of available color variables to use within widgets are limited.

If we try to re-use currently available color variables for new widget, it will interfere with existing widget colors and will result in mass confusion from resellers.

Possible solutions:
1. Extend current amount of colors setting in shop editor.
As a simple solution we can add small list of colors to existing set, under Design > Widget Farben section, such as primary/secondary buttons text color and border text, tab text color, selected step background and border colors, form fields text/background/border colors, including colors when field is focused or is not valid, and also success/error messages color.

2. Create additional view tab for new Widget.
As more flexible solution it would be good to create additional tab next to "Produktübersicht" and "Produktdetails". Inside this tab we can add Design section where we can add colors setting specificaly for new widget, where we can cover all the colors based on design, as well as add posibility to specify hover/focus colors for input fields and for buttons. Also this way it would be much easier to customize global settings for products inside widget, such as enabling "Buy as a Gift" tab globaly, such as font settings and theme dark/light switch.

3. Change design to be more "whitelabel".
As a last option, to avoid extra backend changes, we can change a bit design, so it will be more "whitelabel", thus more easy to implement existing list of colors, and skip extra colors required for form fields focus and other hover stylings.

Here are the list of colors required for new widget design (* marked colors which are new):

text
link
link-hover *

background

border

tab-background
tab-text *
tab-inactive-background *
tab-inactive-text *
tab-inactive-border *

selected-step-text *
selected-step-background *
selected-step-border *

price *
price-old *
price-sale

field-text *
field-border
field-background *
field-focus-text *
field-focus-border *
field-error-text *
field-error-border *

button-primary-text *
button-primary-background
button-primary-focus-background *
button-primary-inactive-background *

button-secondary-text *
button-secondary-background
button-secondary-focus-background *
button-secondary-inactive-background *

checkout-step-background *
checkout-step-border *

message-error *
message-success *

calendar-text
calendar-inactive *
calendar-available
calendar-high-demand
calendar-sold-out
calendar-selected

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1575888610191,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64937","author":"sergey.chorny","authorFullName":"Sergey Chorny","issueId":"dev-14645","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Alexander Bechte @Walid Dechri @György Horváth

Here are the list of thigs what been discussed before:

1. Widget in Shop Editor

= Problem:

There is no poossibility to preview widget in shop editor, to see how it looks when colors/options are changes.

= Expected:

As a possible solution we can add another tab in shop editor preview section, where we will show preview of widget.

Also, currently there is no possibilty to choose which product you want to see in shop editor. It would be good to have a product list dropdown, where you can select product to preview it in product and widget preview tab.

2. Design view for Desktop

= Problem:

As we have only design for mobile/tablet, on wide desktop screens widget looks "stretched", with long horizontal lines and dropdowns.

= Expected:

Maybe we can have examples of desktop view design. Page elements can be left aligned, and have limited max width, especially on checkout steps.

Maybe as an idea, we can have a version of booking widget for wide desktop screen, where options selection, cart, and checkout steps can be shown in one screen, side by side, similar to dashboard booking. Or maybe we can show product and gift selection side by side, without tabs when there is enought space for it.

3. Go to Cart:

= Problem:

When user adds product to cart and goes back to start point, there is no way to go back to cart.

= Expected:

It would be good to have some kind of cart button. As an idea, after user adds product to cart, we can show cart button on the right side of "add to cart" button with icon and qty number. Please provide design examples.

4. Bundle Product:

= Problem:

We have no design for bundle products, current imlementation based on what we already have in old widget. Bundle view isn't optimized in terms of UI.

= Expected:

Please try to improve design for bundle product. We have reordering functionality for options, which might be glitchy on mobile/tablet users as dragging. Maybe we can think about different, more user friendly way to let user reorder options with clicks. Such as "click to reorder", and then we can show icons move up/down to reorder options on click. At least, this way we don't need to load heavy dragndrop script initially.

5. Product prices & taxes

= Problem:

There is no button to remove product from cart on cart page. Also, there is no reservations timer (do we need it)? Also do we still need to have payment methods logos and reseller phone number there?

= Expected:

Please provide design example of remove from cart button.

6. Language & Currencies dropdowns

= Problem:

When we show both dropdowns on page, it is taking quite a lot of space, especially for mobile views it could be a problem.

= Expected:

Maybe we can merge these two dropdowns, and show them together inside one dropdown line. So that currently selected language will be on left and currency on right side. When you click on one of them, same dropdown will share different list of options inside.

7. Time Slots

= Problem:

Some of our resellers have a big amount of time slots. With current design widget can be a really long in this case.

= Expected:

Maybe it is possible to use less spacing around and inside of time slots if height of time slots container is more than eg. 400-500px. Please advise here.
